Description: Diademed head of Alexander the Great with horn of Zeus Ammon and long hair, right. (obverse)
Eagle standing on thunderbolt with wings outstretched, left; border of dots. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Kingdom of Egypt Ancient Greece and Rome: Kingdom of Egypt
Curator's comments: obverse identified as Zeus Ammon by Price.
Bibliographic references: Svoronos 1904 / Τα Νομισματα του Κρατους των Πτολεμαιων (The Coins of the Ptolemaic Kings) (452) (type)
SNG Copenhagen / Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum: The Royal Collection of coins and medals, Danish National Museum (43 vols) (42) (type)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ptolemy II Philadelphos
